Comment: Thank you for the gift article. I read the interview and as usual Trump damns himself, and I know that reporters have to tread carefully with him in order to keep access, but damn…we’re in a constitutional, nationwide, worldwide crisis, and I feel like the media is wearing slippers to a minefield.   Trump is being allowed to glide over the most difficult topics without much pushback , e.g., him saying that of course he’ll follow court orders, IF he believes they’re “legal.” It’s not the first time he’s said that, and it plays right into his EO on the Justice Department—that they alone can “interpret” the law.   And again, Trump is allowed to claim that the people being deported were all criminals, or were all here without documentation, when we all know that deportees here legally, studying, working with green cards, are being detained and deported, and many of them without any prior notice. Visas are being revoked with no notice or short notice and then the holders of those Visas are being labeled as “criminals, here illegally” because the system made it so, at least on paper.   Trump, standing in his office with Charles Schwab, bragging about him making billions after Trump’s stock market plummet and rise. The crypto/meme coin scandal. The emoluments clause and how that seems to have gone by the wayside. The million dollar dinners sold to dine with the President. The new “Executive Club” that promises access for a $500K fee. So much more.  I’m old enough to remember how the news media handled Watergate and Nixon. It was unrelenting, factual, and decisive. And compared to what Trump’s administration is doing, it feels like child’s play.
